Info Slide: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences is made up of around 9,000 voting members who are split into seventeen branches (e.g. actors, directors, cinematographers, sound editors). During the nominations stage of the Academy Awards (officially and popularly known as "The Oscars") process, each member is only entitled to vote for the award which corresponds to the branch (e.g. the director branch decides which films will be nominated for the Academy Award for Best Director), with the exception of Best Picture, which all members are entitled to vote on. In the final stage of the voting process, which determines which nominee wins the award, all members are entitled to vote in every category. There is no upper limit on membership numbers, however, sponsorship from two existing members is required.
Motion: THBT the nominees and winners of the Oscars should always be decided by public vote
